properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is covered for participants & volunteers. Buses between the city and the Eastern Suburbs will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Significant road closures and widespread parking restrictions will be in place between the Sydney CBD and Bondi Beach while up to 70,000 people take part in the 14km City 2 Surf fun run.

Roads close from 3.30am in the city, with major closures along the course from 6am between Woolloomooloo and Edgecliff and from 7am between Double Bay and Bondi. Roads start reopening from 11.30am in the city then between 1pm and 2pm in the east. Roads at Bondi Beach remain closed until 4pm.

MAJOR ROAD CLOSURES

  • Sydney CBD between 3.30am and 12pm: sections of College St, Macquarie St, St James Rd, Park St and William St.
  • Woolloomooloo to Edgecliff from 6am to 12pm: William St from Yurong St through to New South Head Rd at Ocean Ave. No access to the city via New South Head Rd west of Ocean St until 12pm, alternate route via Oxford St.
  • Double Bay to Rose Bay from 7am to 1pm: New South Head Rd from Ocean Ave to Dover Rd.
  • Rose Bay to North Bondi from 7am to 2pm: New South Head Rd from Dover Rd to Old South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd from New South Head Rd to Oceanview Ave and Military Rd from Old South Head Rd to Blair St.
  • Bondi Beach between 6am and 4pm: Campbell Pde from Hall St to Blair St from 6am. Campbell Pde from Dudley St to Hall St and Lamrock Ave from 7am.
  • Bondi Junction from 9.30am to 3pm: sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St and Oxford St. Bondi Rd will also be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Motorists are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd.

Vehicle crossover points will be maintained at specific locations along the course until 7am and 7.15am, once the course is locked down there is no vehicle crossing until roads reopen. It is a fineable offence to drive on or exit a driveway onto a closed road. Pedestrian crossing is permitted when there are safe gaps between runners.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect along both sides of the entire 14km course this year from 1am to 12pm from the city to Rose Bay and from 1am until 4pm along the remainder of the course to Bondi Beach. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and also apply to local residents with parking permits and TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Cycleways will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal.   

BONDI BEACH FROM 6AM TO 4PM                

  • Lamrock Ave between Campbell Pde and Sir Thomas Mitchell Rd westbound

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle course crossover points:

Crossover points along the course will be maintained for local access until 7am or 7.15am, depending on the location. After these times there will be no vehicle access permitted while the run is underway until roads have safely reopened to traffic.  

  • Woolloomooloo: Crown St at William St two-way crossover open until 7:15am
  • Darlinghurst: Victoria St / Darlinghurst Rd and Ward Ave crossover (remains open throughout event). Access to Cross City Tunnel and Craigend St (westbound only) is maintained via McLachlan Ave only.
  • Darling Point: Exit only one-way from New Beach Rd to Neild Ave open until 7am
  • Edgecliff: Exit only one-way from Ocean Ave to Ocean St open until 7:15am
  • Double Bay: Exit only one-way from Cross St to Bellevue Rd until 7:15am
  • Vaucluse: Towns Rd / Vaucluse Rd at New South Head Rd two-way crossover open until 7:15am
  • Vaucluse/Watsons Bay: Exit only one-way from Old South Head Rd at New South Head Rd until 7:15am
  • North Bondi/Bondi Beach: Exit only one-way from Brighton Blvd and Ramsgate Ave at Campbell Pde open until 7am  

Local access

Bondi Rd will be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Local residents are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd.

Residents north of Bondi Rd should use Old South Head Rd to enter or exit the area. Residents south of Bondi Rd should use Birrell St. Â·        Local access for residents at Bondi Beach will be maintained via Curlewis, Gould and Hall Streets

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: William St, New South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd, Military Rd & Campbell Pde

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Storm at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 7:50pm and full-time approx. 9:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium during the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: West Tigers v Sharks at Scully Park. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full time approx 7:30pm.

Roads approaching Scully Park are expected to be busier than usual including Kent St, Belmore St, Bridge St/Oxley Hwy, Duri Rd and Goonoo Goonoo Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium. 

Motorists driving through Tamworth should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Eels v Rabbitohs at CommBank Stadium. NRL Kick off from 7:55pm and full-time around 9:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium during the busy Friday evening peak.

The following roads outside the stadium will close from approximately 9:30pm until 10:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue:

  • O'Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street
  • Ross Street from O'Connell Street to Trott Street
  • Victoria Road from O'Connell Street to Villiers Street

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Chris Rock at Qudos Bank Arena. Main Act starts from 8:15pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Cowboys at the SCG. Kick off from 3pm and full-time around 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match from 1pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd (open from 12pm). If you're travelling via the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will not open for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 8am until 7pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Ticketholders are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Collingwood Magpies at the SCG. First bounce from 3:20pm and full time at approx. 5:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am until 7pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: Road Closures & Clearways Map - Ferragosto Festival 2022.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Road Closures & Clearways Map - Ferragosto Festival 2022

properties.otherAdvice:
Over 100,000 people are expected to attend the Ferragosto Italian Street Festival in Five Dock on Sunday 21 August, from 10am to 5pm.

Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in place for the festival.

Great North Road will be closed between Queens Road and Lyons Road from 3am until 11pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 2am to 11pm on both sides of Great North Road between Queens Road and Lyons Road as well as on sections of surrounding streets.

Clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal and cleaning.

  • Jersey Lane between Lyons Road and Service Lane
  • Kings Road between Thompson Lane and Great North Road
  • Murralong Avenue* between Great North Road and Ramsay Road
  • Ramsay Road between Smith Lane and Great North Road
  • Ramsay Road* between Fairlight Street and Smith Lane (westbound)
  • Rodd Road between Jersey Lane and Great North Road
  • Second Avenue between 118 Second Avenue and Great North Road (westbound)
  • Thomson Lane* between Garfield Street and Kings Road (southbound)

Note: *Local resident access will be maintained.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


FIVE DOCK


FROM 2AM TO 11PM

  • Barnstaple Road between Waterview Street and Great Northern Road (westbound)
  • Barnstaple Road between Great North Road and Jersey Lane (eastbound)
  • Fairlight Street between Great North Road and Ramsay Road (eastbound)
  • First Avenue between Great North Road and Waterview Street (both sides)
  • Garfield Street between Great North Road and Thompson Lane (both sides)
  • Great North Road between Queens Road and Lyons Road (both sides)
  • Henry Street between West Street and Great North Road (eastbound)
  • Kings Road between Great North Road and Thompson Lane (westbound)
  • Lyons Road* between Great North Road and McKinnon Avenue (eastbound)
  • Lyons Road* between Trevanion Street and Great North Road (westbound)
  • Park Road between First Avenue and Fairlight Street (southbound)
  • Ramsay Road between Smith Lane and Great North Road (westbound)
  • Ramsay Road between Great North Road and Cashmans Lane (eastbound)
  • Rodd Road between Great North Road and Jersey Lane (both sides)
  • Second Avenue between Great North Road and 118 Second Avenue (eastbound)  

Note: *Authorised route buses excepted.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.diversions: Motorists will be diverted around the closure of Great North Rd via Lyons Rd, Ingham Ave, Fairlight St, Queens Rd and Harris Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Dog Lovers Show at Sydney Showground on Saturday 6 and Sunday 7 August from 9:30am until 5pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

Traffic within the precint may be heavier than usual on Saturday afternoon and evening with an AFL match taking place at neighbouring GIANTS Stadium. Allow extra travel time heading home.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Knights at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. NRL kick-off from 4:10pm, full time around 6:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive
